item.title: Death Stranding 2 Shouldn't Miss the Chance to Jump On a PlayStation Trend
item.description:
Death Stranding 2: On the Beach is right around the corner, and many are eager to find out how Hideo Kojima's wild post-apocalyptic adventure compares to its predecessor. Leading up to its June release, Kojima Productions has teased a lot of exciting features set to be included in Death Stranding 2 , but there are bound to be even more surprises in store, too.

It's been made clear by early footage that exploring in Death Stranding 2 is being brought to even greater heights. From new terrain to different environmental hazards, Death Stranding 2 promises a more well-rounded experience overall. The first Death Stranding had its fair share of fun Easter eggs hidden in its world, but if the sequel wants to take this even further, then taking note of PlayStation's tradition of referencing other exclusive franchises might be the key to doing so.

Death Stranding 2 Can Add an Extra Layer to Its Exploration With PlayStation Easter Eggs

Astro Bot is Far From the Only Reference-Heavy PlayStation Title

A lot of the charm of Astro Bot hinges on its premise as a fun-filled ode to the PlayStation. There are a whopping 195 cameos in Astro Bot that call back to beloved PlayStation series, but this award-winning platformer definitely isn't the first time Sony-exclusive developers have embraced calling out other games.

Ghost of Tsushima , The Last of Us , and Horizon Zero Dawn all reference other games in subtle ways. When it comes to Horizon Zero Dawn , the reference in question is actually Death Stranding . Since Kojima Productions uses Guerrilla Games' Decima engine, this homage only makes sense, but it's still a fun surprise for fans of the Kojima story. If Death Stranding 2 wanted to surprise players even further, going all-in with Easter eggs could help incentivize exploring every possible corner of the game's world.

Ghost of Tsushima references past Sucker Punch games Sly Cooper and Infamous , while Naughty Dog's The Last of Us features plenty of Jak and Daxter Easter eggs.

Death Stranding's Blend of Wackiness and Sincerity Makes it a Great Game to Embrace Fun References

The universe that Kojima and the rest of the team at Kojima Productions have brought to life is truly unique. An apocalyptic world that is ravaged by tar-like ghosts is strange enough, but deeper concepts like BBs and The Beach can be a lot to wrap one's head around. The ideas brought forth in Death Stranding can sometimes even border on goofy, but Sam and his story help ground the world, offering a strong balance of out-of-this-world concepts and an emotional journey.

The first Death Stranding wasn't afraid to lean into its playful side with items like the Otter Hood, so the sequel could be the perfect story to have fun with shouting out other PlayStation IPs. Hideo Kojima is skilled at finding unexpected ways to surprise players, and wild Sony-inspired cameos might be a great twist.

From new terrain to different environmental hazards, Death Stranding 2 promises a more well-rounded experience overall.

Death Stranding 2 has already featured a nod to a past Kojima game. The brand-new character Neil looks an awful lot like Solid Snake from Metal Gear Solid .

Death Stranding 2's Mysterious Story is About to Unfold

  • Death Stranding 2 launches for the PS5 on June 26, 2025.
  • The game has already gone gold.

The wait to learn more about Sam and his allies on their journey isn't much longer. With returning characters mixed with a fresh cast, Death Stranding 2 is teasing a much bigger story than its predecessor's already daunting narrative. As one of the biggest launches of the year, it will be exciting to see how Death Stranding 2 improves upon the first game.

item.title: Genshin Impact Leak Gives Update on Durin's Potential Release Window
item.description:
Summary

  • According to a leak, Durin, a legendary shadow dragon, will not be playable in Version 5.8.
  • Version 5.6 introduces Escoffier and Ifa on the same limited banner cycle for players to try and obtain.
  • Version 5.7 will add two playable units, bringing the total to 16 characters, with speculation on who the next might be.

A Genshin Impact leak has revealed important information about the release date of one of the game's legendary creatures, the shadow dragon Durin. Since Natlan was released in Genshin Impact Version 5.0, every update has featured at least one new five-star character.

The ongoing update, Version 5.6, has introduced two new playable units: the famous Fontaine chef Escoffier and Natlan's Saurian veterinarian Ifa. Both are featured on the same banner cycle, meaning that players can only spend their Primogems on one limited banner to try and obtain them. Even though they arrived just a few days ago, Genshin Impact has already announced two roster additions for Version 5.7.

Over the last couple of years, Genshin Impact has followed a pattern of adding 17 characters per major update. Since Version 5.7 will introduce two new playable units, bringing the total count to 16, players can expect one more new character in 5.8, as it will likely be the final patch before the next major update. In recent weeks, players have speculated about who this character might be, with many suggesting it could be the legendary dragon Durin. One of Genshin Impact ’s recent cutscenes revealed a human form of a young Durin. However, a credible leaker known as hxg_diluc has stated that Durin will unfortunately not be playable in Version 5.8. Back in December 2024, the same leaker also claimed that HoYoverse would not release any new five-star male characters in Genshin Impact during the Natlan arc, a prediction that has proven accurate so far.

Genshin Impact: Durin Release Date Expectations

During Genshin Impact ’s cataclysm, Durin invaded Mondstadt and was defeated by Dvalin, the famous Anemo dragon. The remains of his corpse fell onto the Vindagnyr mountain, which is why it became known as Dragonspine. In his dragon form, Durin is depicted as a black skeletal dragon with glowing red eyes. In terms of size, Durin is significantly larger than Dvalin, who is currently considered one of the largest dragons in Genshin Impact .

The shadow dragon was created by Rhinedottir in the lost civilization of Khaenri'ah and serves as a catalyst for many storylines that Travelers encounter, especially in the earlier stages of the game. While he is unlikely to appear in Version 5.8, recent leaks suggest that the first Nod-Krai updates will feature some of the most powerful characters in Genshin Impact .

Another legendary character expected to arrive in the foreseeable future is Varka, the Grandmaster of the Knights of Favonius. While Varka’s appearance remains a mystery, players had the opportunity to hear his voice for the first time in one of the recent Genshin Impact trailers.

item.title: Helldivers 2: How to Destroy Illuminate Stingrays
item.description:
The Illuminate Stingray jets (also called Interlopers) are a different kind of enemy in Helldivers 2 . Instead of lingering on the battlefield for any amount of time, these alien vehicles dart in and out of combat, performing strafing runs on players and forcing squads to scramble for cover. Their presence isn't as oppressive as Automaton Gunships, but the threat they pose is just as serious.

When it comes to fighting any faction in Helldivers 2 , bringing the right loadout is the key to success. In this guide, we'll be covering the best weapons players can use specifically for taking down Illuminate Stingrays without hampering their effectiveness against everything else this faction throws at them.

Best Weapons Against Illuminate Stingrays in Helldivers 2

Continuing with the Illuminate's trend of using no heavy armor, Stingrays can be brought down by anything that can penetrate medium armor . They're fairly durable though, so while weapons like the Liberator Penetrator can take them down, it'll take a while before they can do so. The best weapons to use against these squid ships are:

  • PLAS-101 Purifier
  • PLAS-1 Scorcher
  • R-36 Eruptor Rifle
  • APW-1 Anti-Materiel Rifle
  • WASP Launcher

Plasma Rifles

Either the Purifier or the Scorcher can destroy Stingrays fairly quickly, so long as players can hit enough shots before the Stingray flies off . For Purifier fans, it's better to just spam your weapon at the general direction of the enemy jet instead of charging up your shots.

The good thing about these plasma rifles is that they're also effective against every other Illuminate enemy except for Harvesters . This is especially true for Overseers and the hulking Fleshmobs. Just be careful when firing these rifles at anything that gets too close to you or your teammates.

Eruptor

Thanks to the Eruptor's damage profile and how Shrapnel works in the game, this weapon can reliably take out Stingrays with 1-2 direct hits . This is the best performance players can get from a primary weapon when it comes to taking Stingrays out, and since they move at a predictable pattern, hitting them shouldn't be hard to do at all.

The Eruptor is also very similar to the plasma rifles in terms of performance against other Illuminate units. Harvesters will still take a while to kill with this weapon, and if you don't have anything to strip Harvester shields with, you're going to have a horrible time against them. Make sure to bring an Eruptor loadout that works best against the Illuminate.

Support Weapons

The APW-1 Anti-Materiel Rifle is arguably the best support weapon against the Illuminate . It deals with all of their units with surprising efficiency, and it's light enough to enable decent mobility for when things get dicey. You'll still need a second or two to line up your shots, though, but that's where the WASP Launcher comes in.

The StA-X3 WASP Launcher fires small rockets that track whatever the weapon is locked onto. If you're having trouble hitting Stingrays with the AMR or any other weapon, then the WASP Launcher is your best option.

Like every other weapon mentioned above, the WASP Launcher is also very versatile when it comes to fighting Illuminates. It can lock onto Overseers, Fleshmobs, and Harversters, and can kill all those targets reasonably quickly.

item.title: Oblivion Remastered Player Shares Their Impressive Themed Office
item.description:
Summary

  • The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered has attracted over 4 million players and is among the top-selling games of 2025.
  • A fan showcased a dedicated themed office space inspired by Bethesda's popular fantasy RPGs.
  • The return of the classic RPG has sparked fan creativity, including an impressive oil painting.

One fan playing The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered has shown off their impressive themed office setup, which includes numerous nods to the popular title. The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered is an RPG originally created by Bethesda, and it's available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC. While unconfirmed, it has been rumored that the game could be coming to Nintendo Switch 2 at some point in the future.

The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered has been a massive success for both Xbox and Bethesda. Despite being shadow-dropped on April 22 with no real marketing leading up to its release, it quickly attracted over 4 million players across multiple platforms. The popular action RPG is also available on Xbox Game Pass, which gives tons of gamers immediate access to the title. It has even managed to become the third best-selling title of 2025 so far, trailing behind massive hits like Monster Hunter Wilds and Assassin's Creed Shadows . Many fans have praised the game for looking more like a remake than a remaster, as it boasts impressive visual upgrades alongside mechanical improvements to its gameplay. The return of this classic RPG has inspired many fans to show their love of the franchise in various ways.

In a recent post on Reddit, Count_Lorgren showed off their impressive office space, which houses a gaming setup dedicated to Bethesda's popular fantasy RPGs. One of the images showed several game guides stacked on top of one another for titles like Morrowind , Oblivion , and Skyrim , all of which take place in the Elder Scrolls universe. They even posted images of their journal, where they've written down helpful stats and notes to use on their journey through the game.

One Oblivion Remastered Player Creates an Impressive Gaming Setup

Their desk also featured several candles, a pipe, a mortar and pestle, and a rustic mug to drink from. Their office space also has several nods to other franchises in the genre, such as The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt and The Lord of the Rings . Count_Lorgren stated that it's a lifestyle, which they appear to have taken to heart.

Many fans have been busy showing off their love of the franchise, like one player who created an incredible oil painting of The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered . The stunning piece of artwork showcases one of the game's earlier locations, which can be seen right after the player exits the sewers. The painting captures the majestic feeling one might get when they first step into the game's open world. With a whole setting to discover and plenty of secrets to unravel, many fans seem to be enjoying their time with the popular RPG.

item.title: Destiny 2: Cruel Mercy God Roll Guide
item.description:
Destiny 2 has sneakily added a new Nightfall weapon into the rotation with Cruel Mercy, an Arc Pulse Rifle that might serve players well as they battle across the Rite of the Nine and prepare themselves for The Edge of Fate . It's always a great idea to gather the best Pulse Rifles in Destiny 2 , and Cruel Mercy could be what players seek if they dare to challenge themselves.

It's essential to know how to get Cruel Mercy and how to get the Cruel Mercy god roll in Destiny 2 so that they can bring home a Vanguard weapon to be proud of by providing players with an Arc weapon that will benefit seasonal artifact bonuses and those who like a little more zap.

How to Get Cruel Mercy in Destiny 2

Cruel Mercy can only be obtained by completing Nightfall activities on any difficulty . There is no dedicated Nightfall that houses Cruel Mercy, so it will drop as an additional reward upon the completion of the activity. Higher-tier difficulties, like Grandmaster, will provide Adept variations of Cruel Mercy. Once players have claimed at least one Cruel Mercy, they will be able to purchase Cruel Mercy from Zavala in The Tower for 5 Vanguard Engrams and 25,000 Glimmer.

Cruel Mercy PvE God Roll in Destiny 2

  • The Cruel Mercy PvE God Roll Perks are: Dragonfly and Rolling Storm

Barrel

Arrowhead Brake

Magazine

Ricochet Rounds

Perk 1

Dragonfly

Perk 2

Rolling Storm

Masterwork

Backup Mag

Origin Trait

Vanguard's Vindication

Dragonfly is a solid choice for perk 1, as it allows players to create elemental damage explosions on their precision kills. These elemental explosions will cause a strong blast that deals decent damage in a 4.5 meter radius, and really helps with ad-control. For perk 2, Rolling Storm is a great choice as it will provide Bolt Charge on final blows, and final blows while Amplified will provide 2 stacks of Bolt Charge. Bolt Charge is great for Episode Heresy, thus making Cruel Mercy a smart choice for Arc builds.

Cruel Mercy PvP God Roll in Destiny 2

  • The Cruel Mercy PvP God Roll Perks are: Lonewolf and Desperado

Barrel

Arrowhead Brake

Magazine

Ricochet Rounds

Perk 1

Lonewolf

Perk 2

Desperado

Masterwork

Backup Mag

Origin Trait

Omolon Fluid Dynamics

Lone Wolf is a great perk 1 choice for PvP, which will improve aim assist, aim down sights speed, and airborne effectiveness. These passive effects are great, and will increase the further away players are from their allies to ensure that their Pulse Rifle is a decent weapon in the Crucible. There are a few choices for perk 2 in PvP, but Desperado is one players might want since a precision final blow increases the rate of fire, which really helps players sustain fire in the Crucible's war.
